Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: regarding the blood in the streets discussion earlier: https://medium.com/@sunnyday.james/estimating-the-break-even-price-for-new-bitcoin-mining-units-88e39a0f5f9a

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: Break even (BE) back in 2014/15 was support, we were at bottom of BE this year with sporadic upward movements.

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: around 6k

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: New  current and upcoming BE seems to be 7300

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: on avarage we are likely to end up around 36k mean BTC price end of 2019 wit rising BE

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: upper standard deviation of 3.2 is 42k, lower spectrum of 1.8 is around ~24k

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: I believe it will keep going sideways for sometime, not all indicators are reset yet

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: maybe a rally up to 11k and then down again.

Author: bpkdasbaum#4592
Content: @ComputerGenie ðŸ‘´ðŸ¼ðŸ“¢ killing was the wrong word to use. But as a miner if I am below BE thinking from a business perspective I would shut off mining to minimize running costs, but also sell as little coins as possible, simply survice until BTC prices are up again to sell at better profit margins. maybe not right out killing the supply, but reducing it. sell coins only if needed. Also the shift in hash should allow more "non business" miners to get a bugger shared of generated coins. I am assuming here, but as a private miner with a home setup you are more likely to hodl. thanks for correcting and your insights.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nobody did, but could have happened any block prior to recent fix

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: other than the 2016 block diff adjusting period, the total supply will be the same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: unless there was a sudden 90% drop in hashrate (unlikely) any gradual drop will be adjusted for and total supply would be the same

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now, whether the "new" miners are more or less likely to hodl than sell... this is not knowable, if anything the percentage sold could go up, increasing the supply.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think the only think we can conclude from a massive drop in price is a lot of hashrate will be forced to be turned off. What else can be guessed would only be a guess
